headline: Bank of England holds interest rates at 4.5% amid stubborn inflation
summary: The BoE Monetary Policy Committee voted 7-2 to keep rates unchanged at 4.5%, citing persistent services inflation at 5.1%. Markets now price the first cut for Q3 2026.

headline: Battersea Power Station flats see 8% price correction as new builds flood market
summary: Average prices for 2-bed flats near Battersea Power Station have dropped from £625k to £575k over the past quarter as several new developments complete simultaneously, creating a buyer's market.

headline: FTSE 100 rallies to all-time high as mining and bank stocks surge
summary: The FTSE 100 closed at 8,420, driven by strong earnings from Barclays (+6.2%), HSBC (+4.1%), and Rio Tinto (+5.8%). Analysts cite improving global demand outlook.

headline: Croydon regeneration plan approved: £1.5bn investment to transform town centre
summary: Croydon Council greenlit a massive regeneration scheme including 5,000 new homes, improved transport links, and commercial spaces. Property experts predict 15-20% price growth over 5 years.

headline: UK Gilt yields drop sharply after weaker GDP data
summary: 10-year Gilt yields fell 15 basis points to 4.05% after Q4 GDP came in at -0.1%, raising expectations of earlier rate cuts. Bond fund prices rose across the board.

headline: Greenwich property market heats up as Elizabeth Line effect kicks in
summary: Average house prices in SE10 rose 4.3% QoQ with Victorian terraces particularly sought after. Estate agents report bidding wars on period properties near Cutty Sark.

headline: Shell and BP announce record dividends as oil prices stabilise above $80
summary: Shell increased its quarterly dividend by 4% while BP announced a £2bn share buyback. Both stocks rallied on the news with analysts upgrading price targets.

headline: Richmond upon Thames named London's top borough for retirees
summary: A new Savills report ranks Richmond as the most desirable London borough for retirees, with excellent green spaces, transport, and healthcare. Average 3-bed prices sit at £720k, down 3% from peak.

headline: Lewisham house prices dip 5% as buyers wait for rate cuts
summary: First-time buyers in SE13 are holding off purchases hoping for mortgage rate reductions. Average 2-bed flat prices have softened to £395k, creating potential opportunities.

headline: AstraZeneca shares jump 9% on breakthrough cancer drug trial results
summary: AstraZeneca's Phase 3 trial for lung cancer treatment showed 40% improvement in patient outcomes. The stock surged to a 52-week high, with analysts raising price targets by 15%.
